fastcompare_create_select_num_algorithms: Please select number of algorithms to compare
fastcompare_create_footer_placeholder: Enter text that will be shown in the footer
fastcompare_create_about_placeholder: Enter text explaining the user study
fastcompare_create_informed_consent_plac: Enter informed consent that users agree with
fastcompare_create_preference_elicitatio: Enter text with preference elicitation instructions
fastcompare_create_algorithm_comparison_: Enter text with algorithm comparison instructions
fastcompare_create_finished_text_placeho: Enter text that is displayed to users upon finishing the study
user_knn_feedback_help: feedback, could be either implicit or explicit
item_knn_feedback_help: feedback, could be either implicit or explicit
fastcompare_create_data_loader_hint: Data Loader (is bound to some particular dataset)
n_samples_per_bucket: Number of samples for each bucket
fastcompare_create_displayed_name_help: This is a sort of nickname for the algorithm that will be visible to the study participants. Must be UNIQUE! for a single user study
compare_note_text: if item is present in output of multiple algorithms, it is automatically selected for you once you click on any of its occurrences.
compare_hint_lead: Select items that you would consider to buy
compare_hint: Items are selected by clicking on them and each selected item is highlighted in green border. If you do not like any of the recommended items, there is a button at the bottom of this page that you should check. Also answer all the questions below please. When a mouse cursor is placed over a items, its name and genres will be shown. Completion of each step is final and you cannot return to previous steps (pages) - if necessary, you can start again from the beginning.
compare_like_nothing: I do not like any of the shown items.
compare_algorithm_how_compare: How would you compare the two algorithms?
footer_t1: This user study was done at
final_hint: Please answer the questions below before finishing the user study.
finish_hint: If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to contact us.
finish_rec_to_you: items that were recommended to you.
finish_therefore_you_liked: Therefore you liked recommendations made by algorithm
finish_auto_redirect: finish the user study, you can use the button below, otherwise you will be automatically redirected to prolific.co within 15 seconds
finish_therefore_same: Therefore you liked recommendations from both algorithms at about the same.
finish_movies_that_were: items that were shown to you during preference elicitation.
finish_during_pref: During preference elicitation, you have selected
finish_on_avg: On average, you rated recommendations from algorithm
finish_rel_more: These objective importances mean that for you the relevance was more important than for
finish_avg_importance: Average importance values for all the participants (including you) were
finish_for_rel_div_nov: for relevance, diversity, and novelty respectively.
finish_for_div_nov: For diversity and novelty it was
finish_to_rel: to the relevance of the recommendations
finish_relevance_explanation: Relevance describes how the recommendations correspond to your preferences that we estimated during first step of this user study. It does not consider other aspects of the recommendation, e.g. diversity. That means that recommendation only consider relevance of the items may consists of popular, very similar items
finish_diversity_explanation: Diversity describes how diverse/different are the items that you have selected.
finish_novelty_explanation: Novelty describes how new or unusual (not many users have consumed them) are the items you have selected.
